body: Hidden inputs aren't visible though. How would they have validation errors on them?

Let me explain,

For server side ajax validations, I use model validations and return errors in key value pair
For e.g.
Users.name = 'Please enter your name',
Users.gender= 'Please select your gender',
I pass these errors in ajax response, and javascript process these errors in loop and create id in variables (as per cakephp dom id standard)
so generated ids are users-name and users-gender (for hidden inputs I saw ids are like 'users-gender-')
now javascript adds errors messages in form by finding input ids.

Please see screen shot 1: before modifying Form helper, it does not add validation on radio input
 
![16461_ss1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/325154/164883043-e976aa13-d511-4ee6-9fdf-604f3654f4ce.png)

Please see screen shot 2: after modifying Form helper, it does add validation on radio input

![16461_ss2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/325154/164883065-662e0aec-99ee-4956-9f3a-8e736779a9d9.png)

I hope it helps you to understand the issue

Ok. I think there are probably more robust ways to implement that behavior but can also appreciate that a simple solution is also possible. If you're willing to do the work to add the attributes back in and update the tests we can talk about this more.
Yes Mark, this solution is simple and effective in CakePHP 2.x, I can modify Form helper and send pull request.

issue.title: Radio and Multiple Checkbox Hidden Input id added

repository.name: cakephp
repository.description: CakePHP: The Rapid Development Framework for PHP - Official Repository

body:
Hi @markstory I am working on test cases and found 1 more issue in CakePHP form behavior Generating radio options in 2 ways giving different ids Case 1: Without custom name ``` Form->control('Model.field', ['type'=>'radio', 'label'=>false, 'options'=>['Option A', 'Option B']]);?> //output with ids like model-field-0 and model-field-1 SEEMS OK
Form->radio('Model.field', ['Option A', 'Option B']);?> //output with ids like model-field-0 and model-field-1 SEEMS OK ``` Case 2: With custom name ``` Form->control('Model.field', ['type'=>'radio', 'label'=>false, 'options'=>['Option A', 'Option B'], 'name'=>'Model[custom]']);?> //output with ids like model-field-0 and model-field-1 SEEMS WRONG
Form->radio('Model.field', ['Option A', 'Option B'], ['name'=>'Model[custom]']);?> //output with ids like model-custom-0 and model-custom-1 SEEMS OK ``` What are your thoughts?

> What are your thoughts?

The id generation is not wrong. Custom name attributes don't influence id generation in other inputs either.

> > What are your thoughts?
> 
> The id generation is not wrong. Custom name attributes don't influence id generation in other inputs either.

I agree Custom name attributes don't influence id generation in other inputs either in CakePHP 2.x as well.

Then following is wrong only, because it is taking custom name in generating ids

```
<?php echo $this->Form->radio('Model.field', ['Option A', 'Option B'], ['name'=>'Model[custom]']);?>

<input type="hidden" name="Model[custom]" value=""><label for="model-custom-0"><input type="radio" name="Model[custom]" value="0" id="model-custom-0">Option A</label><label for="model-custom-1"><input type="radio" name="Model[custom]" value="1" id="model-custom-1">Option B</label>
```

body:
> Then following is wrong only, because it is taking custom name in generating ids

Possibly, however changing element IDs will most certainly break existing applications so we can't do it until 5.x

issue.title: id attribute not used by Form->radio

repository.name: cakephp
repository.description: CakePHP: The Rapid Development Framework for PHP - Official Repository

issue.body:
### Description

# How to reproduce
Using the Form helper, create a radio control and specify an `id` attribute. In the generated HTML, `id`s of the radio element are built using the `$fieldName` argument instead of the `id` attribute.

```php
<?= $this->Form->radio(
    'is_company_employer',
    ['yes', 'no'],
    ['id' => 'inputIsEmployer']
) ?>
```

produces
```html
<input type="hidden" name="is_company_employer" id="inputIsEmployer" value="">
<label for="is-company-employer-0">
    <input type="radio" name="is_company_employer" value="0" id="is-company-employer-0">
    yes
</label>
<label for="is-company-employer-1">
    <input type="radio" name="is_company_employer" value="1" id="is-company-employer-1">
    no
</label>
```

# Expected behavior
Ids to be built using the `id` argument.
```html
<input type="hidden" name="is_company_employer" id="inputIsEmployer" value="">
<label for="inputIsEmployer-0">
    <input type="radio" name="is_company_employer" value="0" id="inputIsEmployer-0">
    yes
</label>
<label for="inputIsEmployer-1">
    <input type="radio" name="is_company_employer" value="1" id="inputIsEmployer-1">
    no
</label>
```

### CakePHP Version

4.4.6

### PHP Version

8.0.19
